direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle the reason phrase, one for setting and the other for retrieving.
Both methods involve setting a value (reason phrase vs. error code) with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods deal with reason phrases, but one sets a custom phrase while the other retrieves a default phrase based on an error code.
Both methods involve converting data into a binary format, with encode() handling the entire attribute and setReasonPhrase() handling the reason phrase specifically.
Both methods handle data conversion and may encounter similar exceptions related to data format and length.

enhanced_by.reason: Setting the error code is often a prerequisite for setting the reason phrase, as the reason phrase may depend on the error code.
The reason phrase is part of the encoded attribute, so setting the reason phrase should be tested in conjunction with encoding the attribute.
The method to retrieve the reason phrase should be used to verify that the reason phrase was set correctly.
The default reason phrase can be used to compare against the custom reason phrase set by setReasonPhrase() to ensure correctness.
